meanings.definition: Give new strength or energy to
meanings.sent1: After a short nap, I felt refreshed and ready to play outside.
meanings.sent2: I like to refresh my mind by taking breaks during study sessions.
meanings.sent3: The refreshing breeze made the hot day more bearable.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words were like a refreshing drink for my spirit.
meanings.sent5: The rain shower was a refreshing change from the scorching sun.

meanings.sent1: I need to refresh my browser to see the latest news updates.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to refresh your memory before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The software update will refresh the system and fix any bugs.
meanings.sent4: A new coat of paint can refresh the look of an old room.
meanings.sent5: The website automatically refreshes to show real-time data.

meanings.definition: To cool off or revive with water or a drink
meanings.sent1: After playing in the sun, the kids refreshed themselves with cold lemonade.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer refreshed in the pool after a long race.
meanings.sent3: The ice-cold watermelon was a refreshing treat on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: She refreshed her face with a splash of cold water.
meanings.sent5: The hiker refreshed at the stream before continuing the journey.
